clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Testing of an Interprofessional, Person-centered Care Concept for People Living at Home With Care Needs.
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Testing of an Interprofessional, Person-centered Care Concept for People Living at Home With Care Needs.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the project is to develop and pilot measures to optimize the person-centered cooperation between nursing services, general practitioners and members of the therapeutic professions in the care of people living at home with care needs, so that hospital admissions and the use of unplanned medical and rescue services are avoided , the quality of life is improved and a deterioration in the need for long-term care can be stopped.

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of hospitalisations within 40 months

clinical_study.condition: Utilization of Medical Care of People Living at Home With Care Needs

arm_group.description: Implementation of interprof Home measures to improve cooperation between nursing services, general practitioners and members of the therapeutic professions in the care of people living at home with care needs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- years of age >18
- receipt of benefits in the form of outpatient care according to SGB XI,
- preliminary / final classification of care ≥level 2
- expected life expectancy >6 months
- informed consent
- sufficient opportunity to answer answering questions about patient-reported outcomes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Living in nursing home / planned move-in within the following 6 months
- claim acceptance of SAPV
- participation in scientific study

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical Study Management on behalf of the Principal Investigator
